title: Product
text:
Platform Overview
Kudoo GRC transforms how organizations implement and maintain ISO 27001 compliance. Our platform brings together governance, risk, and compliance management into a unified solution built entirely within the Microsoft ecosystem, leveraging the tools your team already uses daily.
By integrating with Microsoft Dataverse, Power Platform, Teams, and SharePoint, we create a seamless experience that reduces the traditional complexity of compliance management. Whether you’re just beginning your ISO 27001 journey or looking to enhance your existing program, our platform provides the structure, guidance, and tools needed to achieve and maintain certification efficiently.

title: Product
text:
Core Capabilities




ISO 27001:2022 Framework
Our platform includes the complete ISO 27001:2022 standard with all 93 controls organized across four domains:

Organization (37 controls)
People (8 controls)
Physical (14 controls)
Technology (34 controls)

Each control comes with detailed descriptions, implementation guidance, and audit criteria to simplify your compliance journey.






Structured Implementation Approach
Our platform guides you through every phase of ISO 27001 implementation:

Initial Assessment and Planning
Risk Assessment and Treatment
Implementation of Controls
Training and Awareness
Internal Audit and Review
Certification Preparation
Certification Audit
Continuous Improvement

This phased approach ensures methodical progress toward certification without overwhelming your team.








Role-Based Implementation
Assign specific roles to team members with clear responsibilities:

Project Lead
Senior Management Representative
Domain Owners
Risk Owners
Internal Auditors

Each role receives tailored tasks, workflows, and dashboards to ensure everyone knows exactly what they need to do and when.






Policy Management
Create, store, manage, and distribute all required information security policies:

Information Security Policy
Access Control Policy
Risk Management Policy
And 15+ additional policy templates

All policies are mapped to specific ISO 27001 controls for complete traceability and compliance documentation.

title: Product
text:
Data Model & Architecture
Our platform is built on a structured data model that organizes all compliance elements in a logical, relational framework:



Governance Frameworks
The foundation of our platform, starting with ISO 27001:2022 and expandable to include other standards and regulations.




Domains
Logical groupings of controls by category (Organization, People, Physical, Technology) for better organization.




Controls
Individual requirements with detailed descriptions, implementation guidance, and audit criteria.




Checklists
Step-by-step implementation tasks for each control to guide the compliance process.






Policies
Documentation requirements mapped to specific controls with version management.




Roles
Defined responsibilities within the system with tailored views and permissions.




Tasks
Assigned activities with deadlines, descriptions, and linkage to specific controls.

What is Kudoo?

Kudoo is a comprehensive Governance, Risk, and Compliance platform built within the Microsoft ecosystem. Our solution transforms how organizations implement and maintain ISO 27001 compliance by integrating with the tools your team already uses daily. With Kudoo, you can simplify complex compliance processes, reduce implementation time, and ensure continuous adherence to information security standards.
Our platform brings together all aspects of ISO 27001 compliance—from framework management and risk assessment to policy development and audit preparation—into a unified solution that leverages Microsoft Dataverse, Power Platform, Teams, and SharePoint. This seamless integration creates an intuitive experience that reduces the traditional barriers to effective compliance management.

Why Request a Demo?

A personalized demonstration is the best way to see how Kudoo GRC can transform your ISO 27001 compliance journey. During your demo session, one of our compliance experts will:

Showcase the complete platform with all key features and capabilities
Demonstrate how Kudoo integrates with your Microsoft environment
Explore specific use cases relevant to your organization’s compliance needs
Answer your questions about implementation, pricing, and support
Provide insights into how other organizations have succeeded with Kudoo

Our demonstrations are tailored to your specific requirements and compliance goals, ensuring you get the most relevant information for your decision-making process.

title: Request a Demo
Request a Demo
text:
Frequently Asked Questions



How long does a typical demo last?
Our standard demonstrations take approximately 60 minutes, including time for questions and discussion. We can adjust the length based on your availability and the depth of information you require.




Who should attend the demo?
We recommend including representatives from your information security team, IT department, and compliance stakeholders. This ensures all relevant perspectives are considered during the demonstration.




Is there a cost for the demo?
No, our product demonstrations are completely free of charge and come with no obligation to purchase. We’re committed to helping you understand how Kudoo can benefit your organization.




Can we get a trial version after the demo?
Yes, following the demonstration, we can provide access to a trial environment where you can explore the platform further with sample data or your own information.

Policies
Organizational Policies
Information Security Policy: Outlines the organization’s approach to managing information security.
Risk Management Policy: Defines the process for identifying, assessing, and managing risks.
Compliance Policy: Ensures adherence to legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements.
Incident Management Policy: Procedures for reporting, managing, and resolving security incidents.
Business Continuity Policy: Plans for maintaining operations during and after a disruption.
Internal Audit Policy: Guidelines for conducting regular audits of the ISMS.
Supplier Security Policy: Requirements for managing third-party risks.
People Policies
Access Control Policy: Defines user access levels and permissions.
Acceptable Use Policy: Rules for the proper use of organizational resources.
Employee Onboarding and Offboarding Policy: Procedures for managing employee lifecycle.
Training and Awareness Policy: Ensures employees are aware of security practices and policies.
Disciplinary Policy: Actions to be taken in case of policy violations.
Physical Policies
Physical Security Policy: Measures to protect physical assets and facilities.
Environmental Security Policy: Controls to protect against environmental threats.
Asset Management Policy: Guidelines for managing and protecting organizational assets.
Clear Desk and Clear Screen Policy: Ensures sensitive information is not left unattended.
Technology Policies
Cryptographic Policy: Guidelines for the use of cryptographic controls.
Network Security Policy: Measures to protect the organization’s network infrastructure.
System Acquisition, Development, and Maintenance Policy: Ensures security is integrated into systems from the start.
Change Management Policy: Procedures for managing changes to IT systems.
Backup Policy: Ensures regular backups of critical data.
Patch Management Policy: Guidelines for applying updates and patches to systems.
Mobile Device Policy: Controls for the use of mobile devices within the organization.
